content: stitches remain on needle at end of your round last step slide the 2 stitches to other end of knitting needle insert knitting needle through front leg of first marked stitch purlwise remove marker insert knitting needle through front leg of second stitch purlwise remove marker slide stitches to other end of knitting needle @2020 caroline hegwer 17 notting hill with darning needle slip first stitch off as if to knit skip next stitch and insert darning needle through following stitch purlwise pull all the way through insert darning needle through first stitch purlwise and slip it off coming from back insert darning needle between next 2 stitches and catch front of stitch on left of darning needle knitwise pull knitting needle out you are done @2020 caroline hegwer 18 notting hill knit the sleeves we are ready to start the sleeves transfer the held sts of the first sleeve onto either us6 dpns or 40 us6 starting at the center of the underarm pick up and knit 3 3 3 3 3 4 3 4 4 3 sts knit across sts pick up and knit 3 3 3 4 3 4 4 4 4 4 sts at underarm pm continue in k1 p1 rib for 1 proceed with the same tubular bind off method used in the body of the sweater or a regular bind off in pattern repeat for the other sleeve finishing weave in all ends pin sweater to schematic measurements and steam let the sweater dry completely before removing pins you did it enjoy your notting hill and thank you for knitting my pattern @2020 caroline hegwer 19 notting hill yoke depth 7 3/4 8 8 1/4 8 1/2 8 3/4 9 9 1/4 9 1/2 9 3/4 10 arm circumference 9 3/4 10 1/4 11 1/4 12 1/2 13 1/3 14 1/4 15 1/2 16 1/2 17 1/3 18 1/4 bust circunference 34 38 42 46 50 54 58 62 66 70 @2020 caroline hegwer 20 notting hill connect newsletter ravelry instagram if you share pictures of your the noble thread projects be sure to tag us @thenoblethread and use hashtags #thenoblethread and #nottinghillsweater contact & support questions pattern support and other information please email info@thenoblethread com @2020 caroline hegwer 23
